Property.preferredDefinition: The act of describing distinctive characteristics or essential features.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Workflow and Registration Status Changed per Brenda Duggan; 05.16.18

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis._The act of describing distinctive characteristics or essential features._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Infection of a break in the skin or other tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Splitting of the sutured margins of a surgical wound. Risk factors include diabetes mellitus, obesity, and advanced age.

Concepts.definition: Splitting of the sutured margins of a surgical wound. Risk factors include diabetes mellitus, obesity, and advanced age.

PermissibleValues.value: Secondary operations required for wound treatment (debridement, secondary closure procedures including rotation flaps, free flaps, or skin grafts; includes secondary operations for revision of grafts and flaps)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Secondary Therapeutic Procedure Requirement For Wound Care Management
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._The reason of something._Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

Concepts.definition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The reason of something.

Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

PermissibleValues.value: Readmission to hospital for wound care

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Admission To Hospital For Wound Care Management
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured._The reason of something._Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

Concepts.definition: The condition of being allowed to enter; the activity of admitting someone to something.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
The reason of something.

Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

PermissibleValues.value: Prolonged hospital admission for wound care

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hospitalization or Prolonged Hospitalization due to Device For Wound Care Management
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hospitalization or prolonged hospitalization due to the health damage accompanying the use of device._The reason of something._Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

Concepts.longName: Hospitalization or Prolonged Hospitalization due to Device
Concepts.definition: Hospitalization or prolonged hospitalization due to the health damage accompanying the use of device.
The reason of something.

Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

PermissibleValues.value: Invasive procedures required for wound care (drainage of hematoma, seroma or infected wound collection, use of vacuum-assisted closure therapy)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Invasive Procedure Requirement For Wound Care Management
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure requiring physical intrusion of the body._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._The reason of something._Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

Concepts.definition: A procedure requiring physical intrusion of the body.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The reason of something.

Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

PermissibleValues.value: Deep wound packing required at any time (deep packing defined as packing deep to the dermis in an area of dehisced wound) to an area of the wound measuring at least 2 cm in length

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Deep Injury Packing Requirement All of the Time
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Extending relatively far inward._Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity._Performance of the packaging part of the manufacturing process._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._A response indicating that something happens or happened all of the time.

Concepts.definition: Extending relatively far inward.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
Performance of the packaging part of the manufacturing process.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
A response indicating that something happens or happened all of the time.

PermissibleValues.value: Prolonged dressing changes, including packing of the wound for greater than six weeks due to wound breakdown, and including requirement for wet dressing over a skin graft for greater than four weeks

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Prolonged Episode of Care Wound Dressing Material Greater Than Six Week
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Clinically significant extended treatment time or procedural time._The material used for protecting the wound site from external factors that disrupt healing and cause infection and pain. Effective dressing protects and manages the microenvironment of the healing wound. Management of the wound environment includes consideration of moisture, temperature and the presence of pathogens._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.definition: Clinically significant extended treatment time or procedural time.

The material used for protecting the wound site from external factors that disrupt healing and cause infection and pain. Effective dressing protects and manages the microenvironment of the healing wound. Management of the wound environment includes consideration of moisture, temperature and the presence of pathogens.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
